discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Translating business needs into IT initiatives

The PRIMARY goal of implementing an IT strategic planning process should be to translate business needs into IT initiatives.

IT strategic planning aims to align technology initiatives with the broader business objectives and goals of the organization. By understanding the strategic priorities and requirements of the business, IT strategic planning ensures that technology investments and initiatives are directed towards addressing critical business needs, enhancing operational efficiency, supporting growth objectives, and delivering value to stakeholders.

Of the following, who is MOST appropriate to evaluate the potential benefits of an IT-enabled investment?

discussion.content: Should be A as it is business who benefit from IT-enable investment. Unless CIO is also the business manager for IT projects.

Selected Answer: A
A. Business sponsor

The most appropriate person to evaluate the potential benefits of an IT-enabled investment is the business sponsor. The business sponsor is typically a senior-level executive or manager who champions the investment within the organization. They have a deep understanding of the business goals, objectives, and expected outcomes of the investment.

The business sponsor is responsible for defining the business case for the investment, including identifying the potential benefits it is expected to deliver. They are in the best position to evaluate how the investment aligns with the strategic priorities of the organization and assess its potential impact on improving business processes, increasing efficiency, driving revenue, or achieving other business objectives.

questions.question_text: An IT governance committee wants to ensure there is a clear description of the "data owner" in the enterprise data policy. Which of the following would BEST define the owner of data stored in an external cloud?

choices.B: The vendor who submits the data to the organization via online forms
choices.D: The risk manager who is responsible for protecting data stored in the cloud
choices.C: The business leader who is most impacted by the loss of data
choices.A: The contract manager who monitors the security of the cloud provider

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. The business leader who is most impacted by the loss of data

The best definition of the data owner for data stored in an external cloud would be the business leader who is most impacted by the loss of data (Option C).

Data ownership entails responsibility for the overall management, integrity, and protection of the data. In the context of data stored in an external cloud, the business leader who has the greatest stake in the data and is most affected by its loss or misuse would typically be designated as the data owner.

Selected Answer: C

The best way for an IT governance board to establish standards of behavior for the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) is to direct the creation and approval of an ethical use policy (Option D).

An ethical use policy provides clear guidelines and standards for the ethical development, deployment, and use of AI technologies within the organization. It outlines principles, values, and best practices that govern the responsible use of AI, including considerations related to privacy, fairness, transparency, accountability, and bias mitigation.
